sourcesContent:
import { Question } from "./question-context";

export const QuestionDB: Question[] = [
  {
    question: " What does long term mean in stock market ?",

    options: [
      "(a) time duration equal to 1 year",
      "(b) time duration greater than 1 year",
      "(c) time duraton greater than 1 month",
      "(d) time duration greater than 5 years"
    ],

    answer: "(b) time duration greater than 1 year",

    explaination:
      "The stock market is riddled with uncertainty, but certain tried-and-true principles can help investors boost their chances for long-term success",

    src:
      "https://g.foolcdn.com/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fg.foolcdn.com%2Feditorial%2Fimages%2F143274%2Fwarren-buffett-insider-monkey.jpg&w=1200&op=resize",

    quote: {
      quote1:
        "I never attempt to make money on the stock market. I buy on the assumption that they could close the market the next day and not reopen it for five years.",

      quote2:
        "Only buy something you’d be perfectly happy to hold if the market shut down for 10 years",
      quote3:
        "Buy a stock the way you would buy a house. Understand and like it such that you'd be content to own it in the absence of any market."
    }
  },

  {
    question:
      " What is debt to equity ratio you must take considering your age  ?",

    options: [
      "(a) age must be equal to equity %, remaining to debt investment",
      "(b) age must be equal to debt %, remaining to equity investment",
      "(c) twice age must be equal to equity %, remaining to debt investment",
      "(d) twice age must be equal to debt %, remaining to equity investment"
    ],

    answer: "(b) age must be equal to debt %, remaining to equity investment",

    explaination:
      "Suppose an investor age is 20 years, he should take 20% in debt and 80% in equity. 20% equity for emergency requirements. But if you start investing at later age, make sure majority goes to debt market. Atlast it depends on risk taking ability of individual.",

    src: "https://images.financialexpress.com/2021/05/1-96.jpg",

    quote: {
      quote1:
        "The stock market is filled with individuals who know the price of everything, but the value of nothing.",
      quote2:
        "How many millionaires do you know who have become wealthy by investing in savings accounts? I rest my case."
    }
  },
  {
    question: " Should I consider health insurance as part of investment ?",

    options: ["(a) Yes", "(b) No", "(c) Somewhat !", "(d) Somewhat not!"],

    answer: "(b) No",

    explaination:
      "Health insurance should always be taken considering health as your prority and not as investment option. This mistake is done by majority of people expecting a higher returns at later age but see the time duration that goes with it because time equals mone.",
    src:
      "https://cdn-ccofj.nitrocdn.com/egjTjcapaIUryXYtMcEvzZpvESYVtgkq/assets/static/optimized/rev-6ad7acb/images/family-health-insurance-2048x1002.jpg",
    quote: {
      quote1: "Take health insurance so that you and your family stays healthy"
    }
  },
  {
    question: " Should I consider gold as a investment strategy ?",

    options: ["(a) Yes", "(b) No", "(c) Somewhat !", "(d) Somewhat not!"],

    answer: "(c) Somewhat !",

    explaination:
      "As per a study you must have 10% if investment in gold or gold related stock. Gold prices works inversely with stock market, so you can cover some amount when the stock market crashes. Moreover, investing in digital gold is wiser and in country like India gold is often accumulated in most intensive way and passed on to generations with blessings.",
    src:
      "https://www.quotemaster.org/images/8d/8db4c3fe632b8f165ea8e837e68d55ff.png",
    quote: {
      quote1:
        "Gold is a treasure, and he who possesses it does all he wishes to in this world and succes in helping souls into paradise",
      quote2:
        "Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, also known as the ‘big bull’ or ‘Indian Warren Buffett’ was born on 5th July 1960 in Mumbai, his journey in Titan ies from Rs 5,000 to Rs 19,000 Crores!!"
    }
  },
  {
    question:
      " What should you see before investing in a Company for long term ?",

    options: [
      "(a) You must be aware of business model it carries",
      "(b) You must be aware of balance sheet and income statement  in quarterly results",
      "(c) Know about companies managment and future scope that would run for atleast 5 years",
      "(d) All of the above"
    ],

    answer: "(d) All of the above",

    explaination:
      "Moreover, find a competitive advantage, as all businesses are competing for their customers’ business, and a successful company will continually have an advantage over the competition. Also make sure research and risk assessment is done by you instead of getting tips for any random person, because loss would be beared by you not that person.",
    src:
      "https://englishclassviaskype.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/in-company-English-classes-head2.jpg",
    quote: {
      quote1:
        "Rule No. 1 is never lose money. Rule No. 2 is never forget Rule No. 1.",
      quote2:
        "You can't produce a baby in one month by getting nine women pregnant.",
      quote3:
        "If you aren't willing to own a stock for ten years, don't even think about owning it for ten minutes."
    }
  }
];
